org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition.consumer

类 SingleInputGate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition.consumer.SingleInputGate
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    InputGate

    public class SingleInputGate
extends java.lang.Object
implements InputGate
    An input gate consumes one or more partitions of a single produced intermediate result.

    Each intermediate result is partitioned over its producing parallel subtasks; each of these partitions is furthermore partitioned into one or more subpartitions.

    As an example, consider a map-reduce program, where the map operator produces data and the reduce operator consumes the produced data. 

    
 +-----+              +---------------------+              +--------+
 | Map | = produce => | Intermediate Result | <= consume = | Reduce |
 +-----+              +---------------------+              +--------+

    When deploying such a program in parallel, the intermediate result will be partitioned over its producing parallel subtasks; each of these partitions is furthermore partitioned into one or more subpartitions. 

    
                            Intermediate result
               +-----------------------------------------+
               |                      +----------------+ |              +-----------------------+
 +-------+     | +-------------+  +=> | Subpartition 1 | | <=======+=== | Input Gate | Reduce 1 |
 | Map 1 | ==> | | Partition 1 | =|   +----------------+ |         |    +-----------------------+
 +-------+     | +-------------+  +=> | Subpartition 2 | | <==+    |
               |                      +----------------+ |    |    | Subpartition request
               |                                         |    |    |
               |                      +----------------+ |    |    |
 +-------+     | +-------------+  +=> | Subpartition 1 | | <==+====+
 | Map 2 | ==> | | Partition 2 | =|   +----------------+ |    |         +-----------------------+
 +-------+     | +-------------+  +=> | Subpartition 2 | | <==+======== | Input Gate | Reduce 2 |
               |                      +----------------+ |              +-----------------------+
               +-----------------------------------------+

    In the above example, two map subtasks produce the intermediate result in parallel, resulting in two partitions (Partition 1 and 2). Each of these partitions is further partitioned into two subpartitions -- one for each parallel reduce subtask.

    • 字段详细资料

      • LOG

        private static final org.slf4j.Logger LOG

      • requestLock

        private final java.lang.Object requestLock
        Lock object to guard partition requests and runtime channel updates.

      • owningTaskName

        private final java.lang.String owningTaskName
        The name of the owning task, for logging purposes.

      • jobId

        private final JobID jobId
        The job ID of the owning task.

      • consumedResultId

        private final IntermediateDataSetID consumedResultId
        The ID of the consumed intermediate result. Each input gate consumes partitions of the intermediate result specified by this ID. This ID also identifies the input gate at the consuming task.

      • consumedPartitionType

        private final ResultPartitionType consumedPartitionType
        The type of the partition the input gate is consuming.

      • consumedSubpartitionIndex

        private final int consumedSubpartitionIndex
        The index of the consumed subpartition of each consumed partition. This index depends on the DistributionPattern and the subtask indices of the producing and consuming task.

      • numberOfInputChannels

        private final int numberOfInputChannels
        The number of input channels (equivalent to the number of consumed partitions).

      • inputChannels

        private final java.util.Map<IntermediateResultPartitionID,InputChannel> inputChannels
        Input channels. There is a one input channel for each consumed intermediate result partition. We store this in a map for runtime updates of single channels.

      • inputChannelsWithData

        private final java.util.ArrayDeque<InputChannel> inputChannelsWithData
        Channels, which notified this input gate about available data.

      • channelsWithEndOfPartitionEvents

        private final java.util.BitSet channelsWithEndOfPartitionEvents

      • taskActions

        private final TaskActions taskActions
        The partition state listener listening to failed partition requests.

      • bufferPool

        private BufferPool bufferPool
        Buffer pool for incoming buffers. Incoming data from remote channels is copied to buffers from this pool.

      • networkBufferPool

        private NetworkBufferPool networkBufferPool
        Global network buffer pool to request and recycle exclusive buffers.

      • hasReceivedAllEndOfPartitionEvents

        private boolean hasReceivedAllEndOfPartitionEvents

      • requestedPartitionsFlag

        private boolean requestedPartitionsFlag
        Flag indicating whether partitions have been requested.

      • isReleased

        private volatile boolean isReleased
        Flag indicating whether all resources have been released.

      • inputGateListener

        private volatile InputGateListener inputGateListener
        Registered listener to forward buffer notifications to.

      • pendingEvents

        private final java.util.List<TaskEvent> pendingEvents

      • numberOfUninitializedChannels

        private int numberOfUninitializedChannels

      • networkBuffersPerChannel

        private int networkBuffersPerChannel
        Number of network buffers to use for each remote input channel.

      • retriggerLocalRequestTimer

        private java.util.Timer retriggerLocalRequestTimer
        A timer to retrigger local partition requests. Only initialized if actually needed.
